label: Behavior 73789046
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.3245 + 0.0002 × t - 0.0001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.7162 + 0.0003 × t - 0.0002 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a low but consistent speed between 0.1 and 0.7 knots, indicating controlled movement rather than drifting or anchoring)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG evolves smoothly from ~180° to ~240° over time, showing a continuous turn to the south-southeast)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains within a narrow range of 207°–219°, suggesting minimal rudder activity and stable orientation control)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial: lat(t) ≈ 54.3245 + 0.0002 × t - 0.0001 × t², lon(t) ≈ 9.7162 + 0.0003 × t - 0.0002 × t², where t is normalized time index from 0 to 1 over the observed segment)
